page.title: 10WILDLIFE ON BREAN DOWN-PART2
page.content: MANY BUTTERFIES BREED ON THE DOWN. THE COMMON BLUE,MEADOW BROWN AND MARBLED WHITE AT QUITE COMMON.THE CHALKHILL BLUE IS A RARER SPECIES, OCCURING ONLY WHERE THERE IS HORSESHOE VETCH FOR ITS CATERPILLARS TO FEED ON. GRASSHOPPERS AND BEETLES CAN ALSO BE FOUND.IN AUTUMN YOU MAY SEE BUTTERFLY AND MOTH MIGRATION IN PROGRESS.A CONSTANT STREAM OF TORTOISESHELLS,RED ADIRALS,SILVEY MOTHS AND EVEN LADYBIRDS MOVE EASTWARDS.EVEN DRAGONFLIES MAY BE SEEN PASSING ACROSS BREAN.NATURALLY THESE MIGRATING INSECTS PROVIDE ABUNDANT FOOD FOR THE MIGRATING BIRDS.
